name: Bank Stocks XLF Yield Curve Steepening Strategy
question: How would buying XLF when the yield curve steepens and selling when it flattens have performed?
retailQuestion: Should I buy bank stocks when long-term rates rise faster than short-term rates?
description: Backtests a yield curve-based strategy for the Financial Select Sector SPDR Fund (XLF) that buys during yield curve steepening and sells during flattening. Analyzes the relationship between the 2-10 year spread and bank profitability over 15 years of interest rate cycles and Fed policy changes.

workflow.description: Step 1: Get 15+ years of XLF data covering multiple yield curve cycles
Step 2: Get current XLF market data for yield curve context
Step 3: Calculate yield curve metrics and generate bank sector timing signals
Step 4: Backtest yield curve steepening strategy for financial sector
Step 5: Analyze correlation strength and optimal entry/exit thresholds
